meanings.definition: To sleep in a bunk or shared sleeping quarters.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of hiking, the campers enjoyed bunking in the cozy cabin.
meanings.sent2: During the sleepover, the kids were bunking in the same room.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were caught bunking together past their bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The train rocked gently, lulling the passengers into a peaceful bunking.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rain on the roof added to the soothing atmosphere of bunking in the tent.

meanings.definition: To avoid a responsibility or duty.
meanings.sent1: Instead of doing his chores, he was bunking in his room playing video games.
meanings.sent2: She was bunking from her homework by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent3: The cat was bunking from catching mice by napping in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The student was bunking from studying by going for a walk in the park.
meanings.sent5: The employee was caught bunking from work by taking long breaks in the break room.

meanings.definition: To engage in playful or mischievous behavior.
meanings.sent1: The children were bunking around in the playground, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were bunking around, teasing each other and having fun.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was caught bunking around with the socks, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: The friends were bunking around, pulling harmless pranks on each other.
meanings.sent5: The students were bunking around in the classroom, passing notes and giggling.
